result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jaylen M Johnson
Current: 1130 Irving Place, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: 2243 Racine St, Racine, WI 53403

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments, schooling, and employment if verified with pretrial services. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. No contact with the victim F.H (person, property, residence or family).

AMENDED 9/19/2022 to remove GPS and house arrest.

9:26 AM Defendant Jaylen M Johnson in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Jaylen M Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set at Court's request to address violation reports. 
Defense gives statement as to why the GPS was cut off, indicates the defendant is eligible for diversion and requests bond be modified to have GPS removed as RCAP will not put a new unit on him. 
State indicates this is not her case but this may be an issue regarding the agreement. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: GPS will be removed but $800 needs repaid to RCAP.
